quiz.name: Variables
quiz.introText: For this first tutorial we will make a small program that all programmers knows very well, and that is to say "Hello World!"
quiz.endQuizText: Congratulations!You completed the quiz about Variables!

quizquestions.question: How do you declare a variable that holds text?
quizquestions.correctAnswerText: Correct!  You declare a text string with var text: String

quiz.name: Functions
quiz.introText: For this first tutorial we will make a small program that all programmers knows very well, and that is to say "Hello World!"
quiz.endQuizText: Congratulations!You've just made your first app!Let's try some more :-)

quizquestions.question: How do you declare a variable that holds text?
quizquestions.correctAnswerText: Correct!  You declare a text string with var text: String

quizquestions.question: You have a variable called "name" that is having the value of "Jarle" assigned to it,declare this as a constant instead
quizquestions.correctAnswerText: Correct!  You have assigned a constant to the Variable with let name = "Jarle"

quizquestions.question: Var name = "Willy" how do you explicitly define this variable?
quizquestions.correctAnswerText: Correct!  You have explicitly defined the variable with name:String = "Willy"

quizquestions.question: Choose the correct answer for declaring single and multiple comment respectively
quizquestions.correctAnswerText: Correct!  You have declared a single and multiple comment respectively //single comment or /* multi-line comment */

quizquestions.question: let totalOranges = 60  let totalApplesâ€¦ = 80  Assign an Integer to the blank
quizquestions.correctAnswerText: Correct!  You assigned an Integer to the blank  with Int

quizquestions.question: let tax:Int = 50  let price:Double = 150.53  var totalCost = price + Double(tax) \ What type is totalCost?
quizquestions.correctAnswerText: Correct!  You have assigned the type Double to totalCost

quizquestions.question: How do you declare a variable that holds text?
quizquestions.correctAnswerText: Correct!  You declare a text string with var text: String

quizquestions.question: Which of these examples are an Array?
quizquestions.correctAnswerText: Correct!  You have shown that all the above are examples of Arrays

quizquestions.question: if we have variable favouriteFood is Pizza,how do we declare it as an optional?
quizquestions.correctAnswerText: Correct!  You declared var favouriteFood : String? = "Pizza" as an Optional

quizquestions.question: which of this is an example of an empty array?
quizquestions.correctAnswerText: Correct!  You created empty array with var emptyArray: [Int]

quizquestions.question: Add "Seattle" to the end of this  Array. var cityArray: [String] = ["Portland","San Francisco","Cupertino"]
quizquestions.correctAnswerText: Correct!  You have added  "Seattle" to the var cityArray: [String] = ["Portland","San Francisco","Cupertino", "Seattle"

quizquestions.question: How do you add the two Arrays? var cityArrayA: [String] = ["Portland","San Francisco","Cupertino","Seattle"]  var cityArrayB: [String] = ["Vancouver", "Los Angeles", "Eugene"]
quizquestions.correctAnswerText: Correct!  You have added the two Arrays

quiz.question:
var animalArray: [String] = ["Dog", "Cat", "Fish", "Owl", "Beaver"]
        
        Given the above array, how do we remove an Item at index 4?
            animalArray.removeAtIndex(4)(correct)
            animalArray.removeAtIndex[4]
            removeAtIndex(4)

quiz.correctAnswerText: Correct!  You removed "Beaver" which at Index(4)
